text: A division in an army is a group of usually about 10,000 â€“ 20,000 soldiers, though some divisions are larger or smaller. It is usually commanded by a Major General or equivalent officer. A division usually has a headquarters and at least two Brigades. There are infantry divisions, airborne divisions, armor divisions and other kinds. In the Navy a division may be sub-unit of several ships within a squadron or flotilla, or a functional department within a warship, such as the fire control division. Category:Armies
title: Division (military)
